author: hwright
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_entries): Fix a few test failures as the result of r36810: the
op_root_abspath, and the entry_abspath may be the same, leading to an
attempt to join a NULL value to the parent relpath.  Also, the code was
just wrong. :)

author: hwright
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_entries): Followup to r36809 by changing an if clause to an assert(),
and properly build the repos_relpath.

author: hwright
msg: Some work on wc-ng depth test 17.  This doesn't yet fix the test, but it
prevents it from segfaulting.
The issue is is deleted children of a mix rev copy.  Some of our callers
request that we return a url, which we currently aren't populating, since
we don't have a base node to scan up to populate it with.  So, we scan
the working node instead.  This, in turn, uncovered a problem in
svn_wc__db_scan_working(), which this commit also fixes.
Still more work to be done here, but it's a start.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(read_entries): On a deleted child of a copy, scan upward through the
working nodes to find the repos information.  We may have to scan twice,
since the operation parent may not have the repos_relpath we need.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c
(svn_wc__db_scan_working): If we've got a copy and we haven't found
anything yet, only process it if the status is normal.

author: hwright
msg: Followup to r36806: Ignore the generated test.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc
(svn:ignore): Ignore entries-test
[reverted in r36842]

author: rhuijben
msg: * build.conf
(__ALL_TESTS__): Add dependency on entries-test to fix windows test runner.
[reverted in r36842]
